column3: outlines a series of internal audits planned for the year 2022-23.
Outline Scope
The audits will review the FSA's compliance to selected clauses of the Environment Management System - ISO 14001:2015 standards.

column2: National Food Crime Unit - Banking arrangements
column3: To assess the effectiveness of the National Food Crime Unit's new banking processes and controls in place and recommend improvements where weaknesses are identified.

To assess the effectiveness of the design, implementation and application of procedures for the FSA's Learning and Development activities to ensure that staff have the skills and knowledge to deliver the Agency?s strategy and that outcomes are aligned with the FSA's People Strategy.

To assess the effectiveness of the FSA's Travel and Subsistence policy and procedures to ensure that all travel and subsistence expenditure is valid, provides value for money, and complies with FSA policy.
The audit will review the suitability and effectiveness of arrangements in place for business planning, forecasting and monitoring activities, and the deployment of funds and resources.
To assess controls and reporting over health and safety policies and enforcement across the FSA.

The audit will review the suitability and effectiveness of arrangements in place for the commissioning and use of science, evidence and analysis; areas of research interest process and prioritisation and business case approval.

To assess the effectiveness of cyber/ information security systems and controls established by the Food Standards Agency
and to ensure compliance with Cabinet Office?s mandatory requirements.
The audit will review the application, suitability and effectiveness of the FSA?s Framework policy across the FSA in line with the strategic objectives.
To assess the effectiveness of the FSA?s Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (TSE) sampling and testing controls in approved establishments in England and Wales with veterinary attendance.

To provide assurance on the suitability and effectiveness of procedures and controls in place for residue testing against the requirements of chapter five of the Manual of Official Controls and service level agreements in place.

To provide assurance that samples required by food hygiene law (with the exception of TSE testing and residue sampling) are taken by FSA Operations and Food Business Operators and are tested in line with the requirements under the retained Official Control Regulations 2017/625 (e.g. articles 18 and 39).??
To assess the oversight and delivery of the warm meat legislation in chapter two of the Manual of Official Controls.

To provide assurance on the controls and decision making process in place, including associated legal investigations, in approved meat establishments with veterinary attendance in line with the requirements of chapter seven of the Manual of Official Controls.
To assess the effectiveness of microbiological criteria official controls in achieving the objectives of UK / EU law in approved meat establishments.
To support and assess the effectiveness of Local Authorities in implementing the FSAs Recovery Roadmap
To assess the adequacy and effectiveness of Local Authority arrangements for the delivery of feed and food law enforcement services in England.
To assess the suitability and effectiveness of key elements of the official control regime for shellfish.

column1: # The Internal Audit Plan is a list of audits scheduled for the years 2020 and 2021

column3: OutlineScope
To assess the effectivenss of management information and controls over the new performance management and reward and recognition policies.
The audit will map the assurances / scrutiny over the FSA?s EU Exit work to identify duplications or gaps.
To assess the effectiveness of the risk management standards compared to the HM Treasury risk management assessment framework.
To assess the effectiveness of the post incident review process in the FSA and compare to good practice.
To assess effectiveness of controls over validity, accuracy and completeness of timesheets and throughput records.
To assess FSA compliance with the Cabinet Office Minimum Security Standards.
The audit will review effectiveness of the end of project processes, transition to business as usual and that learnings are captured and shared.
To assess effectiveness of contract management systems and controls in place.
The audit will review effectiveness of contract management arrangements.
To assure traceability official controls? effectiveness at all stages of production.
Follow up audit to assess effectiveness of management actions and policy implementation.
To assess use of official veterinarians flexibility at red and white meat establishments and effectiveness of official controls delivery.
To assess the effectiveness of microbiological criteria official controls in achieving the objectives of UK / EU law in approved meat establishments.
To assess the effectiveness of the food chain information available in Northern Ireland markets.
The audit will review how contractor competency and authorisation is confirmed by Local Authorities.
To review the suitability and effectiveness of arrangements to develop and implement guidance enabling successful delivery of shellfish official controls.
To assess the accuracy, completeness and timeliness of the information recorded by Local Authorities.
The audit will review the provision of out of hours officers.
To assess the re-approval criteria used for reassessing the Farm Assured Welsh Livestock (FAWL) scheme.
Follow up of prior audits to confirm implementation of actions agreed with the Local Authorities
To audit the completeness, accuracy and timeliness of data.
To assess the impact of specific controls set out in the 2014 Food Information Regulations.
To assess the impact of specific controls set out in the 2014 Food Information Regulations.

column1: # The Internal Audit Plan provides a list of audits scheduled for the years 2021 and 2022
column2: which can be accessed through this link: https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2021-22.csv. This plan offers an overview of the internal audits that are being planned for the specified period.

column3: OutlineScope
To assess the effectiveness of management information and controls over the Food Standards Agency's performance management and reward and recognition policies.
To assess the effectiveness of controls and reporting over health and safety policies and enforcement across the Food Standards Agency.

column2: Recruitment and Retention Policy and Practice
column3: The audit will review compliance to government guidance and management information on the effectiveness of the Food Standards Agency's recruitment and retention policies and comparison to best practices.

The audit will review the suitability and effectiveness of arrangements in place for the  commissioning and use of science, evidence and analysis; areas of research interest process and prioritisation and business case approval.
The audit will review the suitability and effectiveness of arrangements in place for reporting on the governance, risk management and controls in place for key Food Standards Agency's programmes.
The audit will review the effectiveness of the end of project processes, transition to business as usual and that learnings are captured and shared.
To assess the effectiveness of the Food Standards Agency's risk management standards against the HM Treasury risk management assessment framework.

To assess the effectiveness of the Food Standards Agency's Incident Management Receipting system, and ability to respond to routine incidents and provide an effective and sustained response to long running or multiple incidents.
To assess the effectiveness of information security systems and controls established by the Food Standards Agency
To assess the implementation and effectiveness of the Food Standards Agency's Environment Management System - ISO 14001:2015

column2: Approval of establishments requiring veterinary attendance (England and Wales only)
column3: To assess the effectiveness of approval and ongoing review of approval status for meat establishments.

column2: FCI / CCIR Follow up (England and Wales only)
column3: Follow up audit to assess the effectiveness of management actions and policy implementation of the Food Chain Information (FCI) and the Collection & Communication of Inspection Results (CCIR) audit report (England and Wales) issued in September 2020

column2: Post Mortem Inspection (England and Wales only)
column3: To assess the effectiveness of official controls for post mortem inspection (including plant inspection assistants role but excluding game handling establishments).

column2: Food Safety Management System (FSMS) (England, Wales and NI)
column3: To assess the role of the FSA officials in providing assurance on the effectiveness of official controls for FSMS / HACCP (excluding traceability and microbiological testing)
To assess the effectiveness of the food chain information available in Northern Ireland markets.
To assess the effectiveness of management controls and reporting on the contract with the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs.
To assess the effectiveness of the risk-based prioritisation of official control activities by the FSA to improve food safety.
To assess the effectiveness of Chemical Safety official controls - additives and contaminants

To assess the adequacy and effectiveness of local authority arrangements for the delivery of feed and food law enforcement services in Northern Ireland. Specifically, the impact of the allergen initiative on the delivery of allergen controls and the enforcement of specific controls laid out in the Food Information Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014.
